Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel wrong area”
Reviews.Author: LisaSam_12
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself was beautiful, breakfast was decent. however, the area was tricky getting into the tourist spots and to eat out at night you needed to head back to the center should have stayed in the center. staff barley spoke english and very useless with where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Professionals”
Reviews.Author: moloch82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located, close to the Metro and Istiklal Cad. The room was cozy, with sat tv, all bathing supplies, a mini bar. I really liked two or three things: -They charged my card an extra night. Before I checked my card statement they contacted me and apologized, returning the money. -I forgot my iphone charger, when I asked for the shipping cost they offered to send it to me FREE of charge. -The head of staff during breakfast was actually working as hard as the staff. Served us tea, fixed the tables. A perfect professional enjoying his job.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: aaalh
Reviews.Content: All in all I was impressed with the hotel. The location is perfect right in the middle of taksim it is also 5 mts walk from istiklal street which has all the restaurants and shopping centers. The breakfast was good..not a wide range of food but it was good. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful with our tours. We ended up taking tours which the hotel helped us book in a daily basis. Much recommended if its your first time in Istanbul. The only issue which needs upgrading is the cleaning service. Our rooms were only tidied neveractully cleaned..bathrooms were not properly cleaned and bedsheets were not regularly changed. The size for triple room was comfortable. I feel the price was too expensive for the service but I enjoyed my stay since we were outside of the hotel most of the day. Also, don't expect to see any view!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: urbanbug
Reviews.Content: i used to stay in madison hotel at my istanbul visits. The rooms had been beautifully renewed. the best point is the location. it's just 5 min.walk away to taksim square. it's nice being so close after all those istiklal entertainments.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, in great area.”
Reviews.Author: Paraskevi99
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very nice decorated rooms, with a gentle staff. The location is really great.

Reviews.Title: “Barely passable - if you're in an Executive Level room”
Reviews.Author: jlf2349
Reviews.Content: We won this trip through Orbitz.com, so you would think that they'd have picked a hotel that would make them proud. However, we were put in a Standard Room for Night 1 of 6. The hotel recently went non-smoking but this room still smelled like an ashtray. Drab, little room to walk past the bed on the way to the bathroom. We were able to get upgraded to an Exec level room for the rest of the stay -- it was far better-appointed, didn't reak but held a constant 25-27 degrees C (= 77-81F!) despite our repeated requests for repair. Staff was hardly service-oriented and could offer no recommendations on restaurants, etc. The best things I can say are that they had a very plentiful and tasty breakfast buffet (included) and the area is convenient with shops, eateries and transportation from nearby Taksim Square. This place would likely meet the standards of European travelers seeking comfortable Tourist Class accomodation, but would not please more finicky Americans (like me).

Reviews.Title: “Be careful w/ this place--there are two different types of rooms!”
Reviews.Author: shigglediggle
Reviews.Content: We were a group of six who booked the Madison Hotel through a package. We paid extra in the package for a "four star hotel". Be aware that there are two floors of rooms that would pass as four star rooms, and then several floors of rooms above those that would barely pass as a two star room. This hotel seems to see if they can get away with putting you in the two star room, no matter how much you paid. The six of us were put into three rooms in the two star type rooms. They were miserable rooms, with bed covers so faded and worn they looked like they were from the 70's, they reeked of smoke, the A/C didn't work in one and the toilet didn't work in another, and the small TVs barely worked either. We thought maybe we got screwed by the travel agent, but instead we went to the front desk to say things were not working, and these were not four star rooms and that we paid extra money for a four star room. The management obliged and changed all of our rooms to the much better, newer rooms just a few floors lower. Everything else was fine except for trying to put us in awful rooms. I would not recommend the hotel based on this because it just seems downright sneaky to say that a place is a four star hotel and then try to get away with putting people in sub-standard rooms, with the actual four star rooms acting as the "model rooms".

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good spa, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: akivalondon
Reviews.Content: Put off a bit by negative reviews which proved entirely unfounded. Perhaps the hotel has been fully refurbished since they were written. Rooms are a bit small and furnished less than luxuriously, but it was all clean, the service was good, the location was great, the spa was fine - though only open from 2 till 10pm - breakfast more than sufficient with good choice. Rooms had minibar, safe, armchair and table, dressing table, stool, sufficient tolietries, air con and 24/7 room service. No view to speak of, though!

Reviews.Title: “sub standard ugly hotel”
Reviews.Author: veralynnuk
Reviews.Content: Sub standard hotel. - the photos on the website are not an accurate representation of the hotel. The lobby was packed with different sofas which make it look like a furniture shop. Unlike the website photos, the rooms are actually pink, green, yellow and red Breakfast is below par. Would especially not advise having dinner there. Even the TV in the room was very badly positioned. Would not advise staying at the Madison Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice pool, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PBMLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Taksim square, north of the old town, therefore a taxi ride away (rates vary from 25-40 lira) depending on the driver! Hotel staff are friendly,amenites are standard, nice pool but very small. Negatives are the noise if your room is next to the lift, also walls are paper thin so you hear people in the next room talking so not ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: thebluenile
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through easyjet and i thought that they might have been reviewing the hotel properly. This is the most horrible hotel I ever slept in. If you like cartoon walls this is your hotel. I was sleeping next to turkish people that used to keep the tv at maximum valume at 4 o'clock at night. Although I tried several times to discuss the issue with the manager there was no luck. Walls are thin layers of toilet paper and you can hear people breathing next door. Staff is not even able to say thank you in English. I had the room with the best view wich was on a flake of dry plasters. You don't realize that they have cleaned the room since the same rubbish from the day before is in the bin when you come back at night. Swimming pool is like a dirty bath. I'd prefer to sleep under a bridge my next time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Moti_M
Reviews.Content: central but quiet place, nice and polite staff, very good breakfast, clean room (306) and bathroom, good and wide bed, etc. second time in istanbul - only in Madison Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: heikegreen
Reviews.Content: The Madison Hotel is in very good location for transport links on taksim square and nightlife and shopping on iskedal cadessi. But the hotel staff are an unfriendly lot. The beds were brick hard, the rooms are noisy. The hotel stafff are not gay friendly. The swimming pool is much smaller than the picture suggests and the use of the spa facilities is 5 Euros per person extra.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: LONDON69London
Reviews.Content: The staff alone are good enough exuse for anyone not to stay at this hotel location is excellent for taskim square rooms not clean quite average run down dull and well below european standards no ironing boards available bathrooms are so so small-no way will it accom two persons standing -carefully plan use of them bedroom left and right of lifts on all floors you hear the lift shafts operate when ever in use walls paper thin one english channel on tv bedroom "long" and narrow you must pay to use the leisure centre facilities including turkish bath despite being a resident of the hotel night staff in particular esp porters are unfriendly and non motivated you can not secure a second room key despite many requests could not have drinking glassess in room changed cause house keeping did not have them on trolley!!!! no attempt to get them if you have no options but ot stay here do not stay on 9TH floor. THIS IS WHERE THE CONFERENCE CENTRE IS AND IS IN CONSTANT USE FROM EARLY MORNING TO LATE NITE-CONSTANT DISRUPTION LIGHT MATERIAL CURTAINS-NO POSSIBILITY OF SLEEP IN DOES NOT OBSERVE DO NOT DISTURB SIGNS

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An average hotel. Lobby is quite dull looking compared to other nearby hotels. Located about 700m to Taksim Square. Double room consists of 1 french bed and 1 single bed. Rooms are comfy and clean but the walls are thin! I can hear people talking, phone ringing and sound of shower from next door/upper level rooms!. Good breakfast.
